Package org.knime.core.webui.node.dialog.defaultdialog.rule

Annotation Interface Effect

@Retention(RUNTIME) public @interface Effect
With this annotation a field, all fields in a class, or a whole layout part (i.e. Section or HorizontalLayout) can be disabled or hidden depending on the values of other fields which are annotated by Signal themselves.
Author:
Marc Bux, KNIME GmbH, Berlin, Germany

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    Effect.EffectType
    This enum represents the effect that a rule has on a setting.

    Multiple rule sources can be combined using logical operations.

  • Element Details

    • signals

      Class<?>[] signals
      Returns:
      the array of ids used in Signal annotations within the same settings context which should be used as building blocks for the rule. If a Signal does not define an id, it is also possible to reference it by condition, but this should only be used when the condition is a custom and unique one in the present settings context. There either has to be exactly one id if no operation is provided or the number of ids has to fit a suitable constructor of the given operation.

    • type

      Effect.EffectType type
      Returns:
      the effect that the rule has on the targeted setting

    • ignoreOnMissingSignals

      boolean ignoreOnMissingSignals
      When set to false, the code will fail on runtime when there is a signal with no corresponding Signal annotation within the node settings. It can be set to true in case multiple DefaultNodeSettings use the annotated field but the effect should only apply to one of them. In this case, there will be no error if signals are missing but instead this Effect annotation has no effect.
      Returns:
      if the annotation is ignored when signals without a corresponding Signal annotation are specified.
      Default:
      false

    • operation

      Class<? extends Operator> operation
      Multiple rule sources can be combined using logical operations.
      Returns:
      the logical operation that should be applied to the sources. This class has to have a suitable constructor for the given number of sources, i.e. either a constructor taking an array of classes assignable from Condition as its sole parameter or a constructor having the given number of parameters which are all assignable from Condition.
      Default:
      org.knime.core.webui.node.dialog.defaultdialog.rule.IdentityOperation.class
